dataType.name: _AliasCommon
dataType.description: A non-volatile handle used to reference this instance. '''This is intended only for use in protocol-independent "common" definitions, and MUST NOT be used in protocol-specific definitions.'''

dataType.name: _AliasCWMP
dataType.description: A non-volatile handle used to reference this instance. Alias provides a mechanism for an ACS to label this instance for future reference. If the CPE supports the Alias-based Addressing feature as defined in {{bibref|TR-069|3.6.1}} and described in {{bibref|TR-069|Appendix II}}, the following mandatory constraints MUST be enforced: * Its value MUST NOT be empty. * Its value MUST start with a letter. * If its value is not assigned by the ACS, it MUST start with a "cpe-" prefix. * The CPE MUST NOT change the parameter value.

dataType.name: _AliasUSP
dataType.description: A non-volatile unique key used to reference this instance. Alias provides a mechanism for a Controller to label this instance for future reference. The following mandatory constraints MUST be enforced: * The value MUST NOT be empty. * The value MUST start with a letter. * If the value is not assigned by the Controller at creation time, the Agent MUST assign a value with an "cpe-" prefix. The value MUST NOT change once it's been assigned.

dataType.name: Alias
dataType.description: A non-volatile handle used to reference this instance. Alias provides a mechanism for an ACS to label this instance for future reference. If the CPE supports the Alias-based Addressing feature as defined in {{bibref|TR-069|3.6.1}} and described in {{bibref|TR-069|Appendix II}}, the following mandatory constraints MUST be enforced: * Its value MUST NOT be empty. * Its value MUST start with a letter. * If its value is not assigned by the ACS, it MUST start with a "cpe-" prefix. * The CPE MUST NOT change the parameter value.

dataType.name: Dbm1000
dataType.description: The value is measured in ''dBm/1000'', i.e. the value divided by 1000 is dB relative to 1 mW. For example, -12345 means -12.345 dBm, 0 means 0 dBm (1 mW) and 12345 means 12.345 dBm.

dataType.name: DiagnosticsState
dataType.description: Indicates the availability of diagnostics data. Enumeration of: {{enum}} If the ACS sets the value of this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}, the CPE MUST initiate the corresponding diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed values are {{enum|Requested}} and {{enum|Canceled}}. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set, and any errors or inconsistencies in the test parameters MUST be detected, either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic test. When the test is completed, the value of this parameter MUST be either {{enum|Complete}} (if the test completed successfully), or one of the ''Error'' values listed above. If the value of this parameter is anything other than {{enum|Complete}}, the values of the results parameters for this test are indeterminate. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), but not if it is canceled for any reason, the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the Event code ''8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE'' in the Inform message. After the diagnostic is complete, the value of all result parameters (all read-only parameters in this object) MUST be retained by the CPE until either this diagnostic is run again, or the CPE reboots. After a reboot, if the CPE has not retained the result parameters from the most recent test, it MUST set the value of this parameter to {{enum|None}}. Modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the test being terminated and the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, setting this parameter to {{enum|Requested}} (and possibly modifying other writable parameters in this object) MUST result in the test being terminated and then restarted using the current values of the test parameters. While the test is in progress, setting this parameter to {{enum|Canceled}} MUST result in the test being canceled and the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. If the CPE does not support the {{enum|Canceled}} value, it MUST return a SPV error with "Invalid Parameter value" (9007) to the ACS instead.

dataType.name: IEEE_EUI64
dataType.description: The IEEE EUI 64-bit identifier as defined in {{bibref|EUI64}}. The IEEE defined 64-bit extended unique identifier (EUI-64) is a concatenation of: * The 24-bit (OUI-24) or 36-bit (OUI-36) company_id value assigned by the IEEE Registration Authority (IEEE-RA), and * The extension identifier (40 bits for OUI-24 or 28 bits for OUI-36) assigned by the organization with that company_id assignment.

dataType.name: IPAddress
dataType.description: IP address, i.e. IPv4 address (or IPv4 subnet mask) or IPv6 address. All IPv4 addresses and subnet masks MUST be represented as strings in IPv4 dotted-decimal notation. Here are some examples of valid IPv4 address textual representations: * 216.52.29.100 * 192.168.1.254 All IPv6 addresses MUST be represented using any of the 3 standard textual representations defined in {{bibref|RFC4291}} Sections 2.2.1, 2.2.2 and 2.2.3. Both lower-case and upper-case letters can be used, but use of lower-case letters is RECOMMENDED. Here are some examples of valid IPv6 address textual representations: * 1080:0:0:800:ba98:3210:11aa:12dd * 1080::800:ba98:3210:11aa:12dd * 0:0:0:0:0:0:13.1.68.3 IPv6 addresses MUST NOT include zone identifiers. Zone identifiers are discussed in {{bibref|RFC4007|Section 6}}. Unspecified or inapplicable addresses (or IPv4 subnet masks) MUST be represented as empty strings unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

dataType.name: IPv4Address
dataType.description: IPv4 address (or subnet mask). Can be any IPv4 address that is permitted by the ''IPAddress'' data type.

dataType.name: IPv6Address
dataType.description: IPv6 address. Can be any IPv6 address that is permitted by the ''IPAddress'' data type.

dataType.name: IPPrefix
dataType.description: IPv4 or IPv6 routing prefix in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation {{bibref|RFC4632}}. This is specified as an IP address followed by an appended "/n" suffix, where ''n'' (the prefix size) is an integer in the range 0-32 (for IPv4) or 0-128 (for IPv6) that indicates the number of (leftmost) '1' bits of the routing prefix. * IPv4 example: 192.168.1.0/24 * IPv6 example: 2001:edff:fe6a:f76::/64 If the IP address part is unspecified or inapplicable, it MUST be {{empty}} unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition. In this case the IP prefix will be of the form "/n". If the entire IP prefix is unspecified or inapplicable, it MUST be {{empty}} unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

dataType.name: IPv4Prefix
dataType.description: IPv4 address prefix. Can be any IPv4 prefix that is permitted by the ''IPPrefix'' data type.

dataType.name: IPv6Prefix
dataType.description: IPv6 address prefix. Can be any IPv6 prefix that is permitted by the ''IPPrefix'' data type.

dataType.name: JSONObject
dataType.description: A JSON Object as defined in {{bibref|RFC7159|Section 4}}.

dataType.name: MACAddress
dataType.description: All MAC addresses are represented as strings of 12 hexadecimal digits (digits 0-9, letters A-F or a-f) displayed as six pairs of digits separated by colons. Unspecified or inapplicable MAC addresses MUST be represented as empty strings unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

dataType.name: StatsCounter32
dataType.description: A 32-bit statistics parameter, e.g. a byte counter. This data type SHOULD NOT be used for statistics parameters whose values might become greater than the maximum value that can be represented as an ''unsignedInt'' (i.e. 0xffffffff, referred to below as ''maxval''). ''StatsCounter64'' SHOULD be used for such parameters. The value ''maxval'' indicates that no data is available for this parameter. In the unlikely event that the actual value of the statistic is ''maxval'', the CPE SHOULD return ''maxval - 1''. The actual value of the statistic might be greater than ''maxval''. Such values SHOULD wrap around through zero. The term ''packet'' is to be interpreted as the transmission unit appropriate to the protocol layer in question, e.g. an IP packet or an Ethernet frame.

dataType.name: StatsCounter64
dataType.description: A 64-bit statistics parameter, e.g. a byte counter. This data type SHOULD be used for all statistics parameters whose values might become greater than the maximum value that can be represented as an ''unsignedInt''. The maximum value that can be represented as an ''unsignedLong'' (i.e. 0xffffffffffffffff) indicates that no data is available for this parameter. The term ''packet'' is to be interpreted as the transmission unit appropriate to the protocol layer in question, e.g. an IP packet or an Ethernet frame.

dataType.name: UUID
dataType.description: Universally Unique Identifier. See {{bibref|RFC4122}}.

dataType.name: URI
dataType.description: Uniform Resource Identifier. See {{bibref|RFC3986}}.

dataType.name: URN
dataType.description: Uniform Resource Name. See {{bibref|RFC3986}} (URI) and {{bibref|RFC8141}} (''urn'' URI scheme).

dataType.name: URL
dataType.description: Uniform Resource Locator. See {{bibref|RFC3986}} (URI), {{bibref|IANA-uri-schemes}}, and individual URI scheme RFCs such as {{bibref|RFC7252}} (''coap'', ''coaps'') and {{bibref|RFC7230}} (''http'', ''https'').

dataType.name: ZigBeeNetworkAddress
dataType.description: The ZigBee 16-bit network address (NWK) as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007}}. The address is assigned to a device by the network layer and used by the network layer for routing messages between devices.

parameter.name: STBServiceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in the {{object|STBService}} table.

object.name: STBService.{i}.
object.description: The top-level object for an STB CPE.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.
object.description: The overall capabilities of the STB CPE. This is a constant read-only object, meaning that only a firmware update will cause these values to be altered.

parameter.name: MaxActiveAVStreams
parameter.description: Maximum number of simultaneously active AV streams supported by the STB. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of active streams. A value of 0, while not strictly illegal, would indicate an STB that doesn't support AV streams, which is extremely unlikely.

parameter.name: MaxActiveAVPlayers
parameter.description: Maximum number of simultaneously active AV players supported by the STB. An AV player is associated with a presentation device (such as a TV set). Note that this is the strict maximum but, depending on the AV streams to be decoded, a given STB may not always have the resources to run all of these AV players, e.g. it might be able to decode one main picture and one PIP in standard definition, but just a main picture and no PIP in high definition. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of active players. A value of 0, while not strictly illegal, would indicate an STB that doesn't support AV players, which is extremely unlikely.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.FrontEnd.
object.description: Front-end capabilities.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.FrontEnd.DVBT.
object.description: Capabilities of the DVB-T receiver.

parameter.name: MaxActiveDVBTStreams
parameter.description: Maximum number of simultaneous active AV streams supported by the DVB-T FrontEnd. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of active streams.

parameter.name: MaxLogicalChannels
parameter.description: Maximum number of logical channels that can be contained in a Service List Database. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of logical channels.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.FrontEnd.IP.
object.description: IP front-end capabilities.

parameter.name: MaxActiveIPStreams
parameter.description: Maximum number of simultaneous active AV streams supported by the IP FrontEnd. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of active streams.

parameter.name: MaxActiveInboundIPStreams
parameter.description: Maximum number of simultaneous active Inbound AV streams supported by the IP FrontEnd. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of active streams.

parameter.name: MaxActiveOutboundIPStreams
parameter.description: Maximum number of simultaneous active Outbound AV streams supported by the IP FrontEnd. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of active streams.

parameter.name: StreamingControlProtocols
parameter.description: Supported streaming control protocols.

parameter.name: StreamingTransportProtocols
parameter.description: Network protocols supported for AV streaming.

parameter.name: StreamingTransportControlProtocols
parameter.description: Transport control protocols supported for AV streaming in combination with RTP.

enumeration.description: supports sending RTCP receiver reports as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550}}

parameter.name: DownloadTransportProtocols
parameter.description: Network protocols supported for AV download.

parameter.name: MultiplexTypes
parameter.description: AV multiplex types supported by the front end.

parameter.name: MaxDejitteringBufferSize
parameter.description: Describes the maximum de-jittering buffer size, in {{units}}, supported by the STB. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the buffer size.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.PVR.
object.description: PVR capabilities.

parameter.name: MaxIOStreams
parameter.description: Maximum number of AV streams that the PVR can simultaneously record. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of streams.

parameter.name: MaxRecordingStreams
parameter.description: Maximum number of AV streams that the PVR can simultaneously record. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of streams.

parameter.name: MaxPlaybackStreams
parameter.description: Maximum number of AV streams that the PVR can simultaneously play back. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of streams.

parameter.name: MaxTimeDelay
parameter.description: Maximum time delay, in {{units}}, that the PVR time-shift mode can support. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the time delay.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.AudioDecoder.
object.description: Audio decoder capabilities.

parameter.name: AudioStandards
parameter.description: Audio standards supported by this STB.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.
object.description: Video decoder capabilities.

parameter.name: VideoStandards
parameter.description: Video standards supported by this STB.

enumeration.description: Same as MPEG4 AVC and H.264 {{bibref|ISO/IEC14496-10}}

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.MPEG2Part2.
object.description: Object describing the set of supported MPEG2 profiles and levels for this STB. It also describes the set of audio standards supported when MPEG2 Part 2 is used as the video standard.

parameter.name: AudioStandards
parameter.description: Audio Standards supported by the Player when associated with MPEG2 Part 2 Video.

parameter.name: ProfileLevelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|ProfileLevel}}.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.MPEG2Part2.ProfileLevel.{i}.
object.description: Table to describe the set of profiles and levels combinations supported by the STB when MPEG2 Part 2 is used as video standard. {{keys}} The table MUST include a distinct entry for each supported combination of these parameters.

parameter.name: Profile
parameter.description: Identifier of the MPEG2 Part 2 profile.

parameter.name: Level
parameter.description: Identifier of the MPEG2 part 2 level.

parameter.name: MaximumDecodingCapability
parameter.description: The maximum decoding capability for this video standard in {{units}}. This strictly depends on the profile and level selected.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.MPEG4Part2.
object.description: Object describing the set of supported profiles and levels for this STB. It also describes the set of audio standards supported when MPEG4 Part 2 is used as the video standard.

parameter.name: AudioStandards
parameter.description: Audio Standards supported by the Player when associated with MPEG4 Part 2 video.

parameter.name: ProfileLevelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|ProfileLevel}}.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.MPEG4Part2.ProfileLevel.{i}.
object.description: Table to describe the set of profiles and levels combinations supported by the STB when MPEG4 Part 2 is used as video standard. {{keys}} The table MUST include a distinct entry for each supported combination of these parameters.

parameter.name: Profile
parameter.description: Identifier of the MPEG4 Part 2 profile.

parameter.name: Level
parameter.description: Identifier of the MPEG4 Part 2 level.

parameter.name: MaximumDecodingCapability
parameter.description: The maximum decoding capability for this video standard in {{units}}. This strictly depends on the profile and level selected.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.MPEG4Part10.
object.description: Object describing the set of supported profiles and levels for this STB. It also describes the set of audio standards supported when MPEG4 Part 10 is used as the video standard.

parameter.name: AudioStandards
parameter.description: Audio Standards supported by the Player when associated with MPEG4 Part 10 video.

parameter.name: ProfileLevelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|ProfileLevel}}.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.MPEG4Part10.ProfileLevel.{i}.
object.description: Table to describe the set of profiles and levels combinations supported by the STB when MPEG4 Part 10 is used as video standard. {{enum}} The table MUST include a distinct entry for each supported combination of these parameters.

parameter.name: Profile
parameter.description: Supported MPEG4 Part 10 profiles.

parameter.name: Level
parameter.description: Supported MPEG4 Part 10 Levels.

parameter.name: MaximumDecodingCapability
parameter.description: The maximum decoding capability for this video standard in {{units}}. This strictly depends on the profile and level selected.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.SMPTEVC1.
object.description: Object describing the set of supported SMPTE-VC-1 profiles and levels for this STB. It also describes the set of audio standards supported when SMPTE-VC-1 is used as the video standard.

parameter.name: AudioStandards
parameter.description: Audio Standards supported by the Player when associated with SMPTE-VC-1 video.

parameter.name: ProfileLevelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|ProfileLevel}}.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.SMPTEVC1.ProfileLevel.{i}.
object.description: Table to describe the set of profiles and levels combinations supported by the STB when SMPTE-VC-1 is used as video standard. {{keys}} The table MUST include a distinct entry for each supported combination of these parameters.

parameter.name: Profile
parameter.description: Identifier of the SMPTE-VC-1 profile.

parameter.name: Level
parameter.description: Identifier of the SMPTE-VC-1 level.

parameter.name: MaximumDecodingCapability
parameter.description: The maximum decoding capability for this video standard in {{units}}. This strictly depends on the profile and level selected.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.AudioOutput.
object.description: Audio output capabilities. The audio output stage may include selecting output formats, selecting output connectors, and copy protection.

parameter.name: AudioFormats
parameter.description: Supported audio output formats. {{enum}} Note that these refer to supported output formats and not to physical connectors.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.VideoOutput.
object.description: Video output capabilities. The video output stage may include selecting output formats, selecting output connectors, and copy protection.

parameter.name: CompositeVideoStandards
parameter.description: Analog composite video standards supported for video output. This applies only to CVBS video output.

parameter.name: VideoFormats
parameter.description: Supported video output formats. {{enum}} Note that these refer to supported output formats and not to physical connectors.

parameter.name: Macrovision
parameter.description: Supported version of Macrovision digital content protection standard.

parameter.name: HDCP
parameter.description: Supported version of HDCP digital content protection standard.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.CA.
object.description: This object describes the characteristics of the Conditional Access, if any.

parameter.name: CASystems
parameter.description: Unique identifiers (e.g. commercial names) of supported CA systems.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.DRM.
object.description: This object describes the characteristics of the Digital Rights Management, if any.

parameter.name: DRMSystems
parameter.description: Unique identifiers (e.g. commercial names) of supported DRM systems.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.ServiceMonitoring.
object.description: This object describes the capabilities of the {{object|.ServiceMonitoring}} object.

parameter.name: ServiceTypes
parameter.description: Supported service types, each of which relates to an AV stream source. {{enum}} Note that none of the standard service types cover LAN-sourced IP streams.

enumeration.description: WAN-sourced IP stream (includes IPTV and VoD
Cable, e.g. DVB-C, Front End stream
DTT, e.g. DVB-T, Front End stream
Satellite, e.g. DVB-S, Front End stream

parameter.name: MaxActiveMainStreams
parameter.description: Maximum number of AV Main streams for which the STB can simultaneously collect statistics. A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of active streams.

parameter.name: MinSampleInterval
parameter.description: Minimum sample interval in {{units}} that the STB MUST be able to support. A value of -1 indicates no specific minimum sample interval.

parameter.name: MaxReportSamples
parameter.description: Maximum number of samples of each statistic that the STB is able to store and report. A value of -1 indicates no specific maximum number of samples.

parameter.name: HighLevelMetricNames
parameter.description: The names of the supported high-level metrics.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Capabilities.AudienceStats.
object.description: This object describes the capabilities of the {{object|.Applications.AudienceStats}} object.

parameter.name: MaxAudienceStatsChannels
parameter.description: Maximum number of channels that the STB MUST support in the {{object|.Applications.AudienceStats}} object A value of -1 indicates no specific limit on the number of channels.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.
object.description: Details of STB logical or physical internal components. Unlike the {{object|.Capabilities}} object, which is read-only and which doesn't describe individual instances, this object contains some writeable parameters.

parameter.name: FrontEndNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|FrontEnd}} instances.

parameter.name: AudioDecoderNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|AudioDecoder}} instances.

parameter.name: VideoDecoderNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|VideoDecoder}} instances.

parameter.name: AudioOutputNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|AudioOutput}} instances.

parameter.name: VideoOutputNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|VideoOutput}} instances.

parameter.name: SCARTNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|SCART}} instances.

parameter.name: CANumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|CA}} instances.

parameter.name: DRMNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|DRM}} instances.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.
object.description: FrontEnd instance table. Each front-end instance, including vendor-specific front-end types, will normally have a sub-object that corresponds to the front-end type (e.g. DVB-T or IP).

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this front-end.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this front-end. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Human-readable name associated with this front-end.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.DVBT.
object.description: DVB-T front-end details. This object will normally be present if and only if this front-end is a DVB-T front-end. Parameters are taken from the DGTVi D-Book {{bibref|D-Book}}.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.DVBT.Modulation.
object.description: DVB-T modulation details.

parameter.name: Frequency
parameter.description: Indicates the current frequency in {{units}}. The value of this parameter is undefined while installing the service list (see {{object|.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.DVBT.Install}}).

parameter.name: ChannelBandwidth
parameter.description: Indicates the channel bandwidth in use.

parameter.name: Constellation
parameter.description: Indicates the current constellation in use.

parameter.name: HierarchicalInformation
parameter.description: Hierarchical parameter alpha. The higher the value of alpha, the more noise-immune the High Priority Modulation is.

parameter.name: CodeRateHP
parameter.description: Indicates the current code rate in use. Code rate applies to HP in case of hierarchical coding.

parameter.name: CodeRateLP
parameter.description: Indicates the current code rate in use. Code rate applies to LP in case of hierarchical coding.

parameter.name: GuardInterval
parameter.description: Indicates the current guard interval in use.

parameter.name: TransmissionMode
parameter.description: Indicates the number of carriers in an OFDM frame.

parameter.name: SNR
parameter.description: Signal/Noise ratio in the carrier band, measured in {{units}}.

parameter.name: BER
parameter.description: Bit Error Ratio before correction, expressed in multiples of 1e-6.

parameter.name: CBER
parameter.description: Bit Error Ratio after correction, expressed in multiples of 1e-9.

parameter.name: Locked
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the tuner is locked on a frequency.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.DVBT.Install.
object.description: DVB-T service list database installation. Supports maintenance of the service list database by scanning frequencies in order to detect services. The service list database is in {{object|.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.DVBT.ServiceListDatabase}}.

parameter.name: Start
parameter.description: Starts (when set to {{true}}) or stops (when set to {{false}}) scanning for services. The value is not saved in device state and is always {{false}} when read. Discovered services are merged with those already present in the service list database. This supports cases where the frequency spectrum is not continuous. In order to force a re-install, the service list database needs to be reset (see {{param|.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.DVBT.ServiceListDatabase.Reset}}).

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of the scanning process. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Progress
parameter.description: Progression in {{units}} of the current scan. The value is undefined when a scan is not in progress.

parameter.name: StartFrequency
parameter.description: Frequency (in {{units}}) at which to start the scanning process.

parameter.name: StopFrequency
parameter.description: Frequency (in {{units}}) at which to stop the scanning process.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.DVBT.ServiceListDatabase.
object.description: DVB-T service list database.

parameter.name: Reset
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, resets the service list database. Setting it to {{false}} has no effect. The value is not saved in device state and is always {{false}} when read.

parameter.name: TotalServices
parameter.description: Total number of services defined in the service list database, i.e. the number of different DvbIds in the database.

parameter.name: LogicalChannelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of logical channels in the service list database.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.DVBT.ServiceListDatabase.LogicalChannel.{i}.
object.description: DVB-T logical channel information.

parameter.name: LogicalChannelNumber
parameter.description: Logical channel number.

parameter.name: ServiceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of services associated with this logical channel.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.DVBT.ServiceListDatabase.LogicalChannel.{i}.Service.{i}.
object.description: DVB-T service information.

parameter.name: DvbId
parameter.description: DVB Triplet {{bibref|TS102034}} that uniquely identifies the service in the service list database. The DVB Triplet is a 12-byte string that is a concatenation of 4 hexadecimal characters for each of the following: Original Network Id, Transport Stream Id, Service Id. For example: * OriginalNetworkId = 8442 = 0x20FA * TransportStreamId = 4 = 0x0004 * ServiceId = 257 = 0x0101 -> DvbId = ''20FA00040101''

parameter.name: Frequency
parameter.description: Transmitter frequency (in {{units}}) for this service.

parameter.name: BER
parameter.description: Bit Error Ratio before correction, expressed in multiples of 1e-6 (indicates the quality of this service).

parameter.name: Preferred
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, identifies this as the preferred service for this logical channel and automatically sets {{param}} to {{false}} for other services associated with this logical channel. When set to {{false}}, cancels this service's preferred status and causes the service with the lowest {{param|BER}} (best received quality) to become the preferred service for this logical channel. Whenever frequencies are re-scanned, all {{param}} parameters are implicitly reset to {{false}}, i.e. a re-scan will always use the {{param|BER}} to determine preferred services, and will discard any past explicit overrides.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.DVBT.LogicalChannelConnect.
object.description: Connect to a DVB-T logical channel.

parameter.name: LogicalChannelNumber
parameter.description: Logical channel number to connect to (the logical channel's preferred service will be connected to). If a {{object|.ServiceMonitoring.MainStream}} instance with ''ServiceType'' = ''DTT'' is currently enabled, the STB MUST ensure that performance data for this service is collected in that instance. The value is not saved in device state. The value when read is not specified and need not be the value that was most recently written.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.DVBT.ServiceConnect.
object.description: Connect to a DVB-T service.

parameter.name: DvbId
parameter.description: DvbId of the service to connect to. If a {{object|.ServiceMonitoring.MainStream}} instance with ''ServiceType'' = ''DTT'' is currently enabled, the STB MUST ensure that performance data for this service is collected in that instance. The value is not saved in device state. The value when read is not specified and need not be the value that was most recently written.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.
object.description: IP front-end details. This object will normally be present if and only if the front-end is an IP front-end.

parameter.name: InboundNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|Inbound}} instances.

parameter.name: OutboundNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|Outbound}} instances.

parameter.name: ActiveInboundIPStreams
parameter.description: Number of {{object|Inbound}} AV streams currently active (i.e. with ''Status'' != ''Disabled'', which means audio or AV data are being processed).

parameter.name: ActiveOutboundIPStreams
parameter.description: Number of {{object|Outbound}} AV streams currently active (i.e. with ''Status'' != ''Disabled'', which means audio or AV data are being processed).

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.RTCP.
object.description: Parameters related to RTCP receiver report generation as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables RTCP receiver report generation.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of RTCP receiver report generation. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: TxRepeatInterval
parameter.description: Transmission repeat interval, in {{units}}.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.RTPAVPF.
object.description: Parameters related to RTP AVPF configuration as defined in {{bibref|RFC4585}} and {{bibref|RFC4588}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables RTP/AVPF receiver report generation.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of RTP/AVPF receiver report generation. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: RetransmitTimeout
parameter.description: Time in {{units}} the receiver shall wait for a retransmitted packet before considering it to be lost.

parameter.name: MinLossPackets
parameter.description: Minimum number of lost packets the receiver shall wait for before generating a retransmission request.

parameter.name: MaxReportTime
parameter.description: Maximum time in {{units}} the receiver shall wait between a lost packet and the generation of a retransmission request.

parameter.name: MaxLossBurst
parameter.description: Maximum number of consecutive lost packets for which the receiver shall attempt recovery.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.IGMP.
object.description: Parameters that are specific to IGMP clients when changing channels.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables all IGMP support on the receiver side of the CPE.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Status of IGMP support on the receiver side of the CPE. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: MaximumNumberOfConcurrentGroups
parameter.description: Maximum number of group memberships allowed simultaneously. For example, this would need to be at least 2 in order to support a Multicast-delivered main picture and a Multicast-delivered PIP.

parameter.name: MaximumNumberOfTrackedGroups
parameter.description: Maximum number of groups for which statistics will be tracked. This relates only to the maintenance of statistics, and does not affect the operation of the STB.

parameter.name: LoggingEnable
parameter.description: Controls logging of IGMP traffic. The CPE MAY choose to throttle log entries, e.g. if joins and leaves are occurring at an excessive rate.

parameter.name: DSCPMark
parameter.description: Diffserv code point to be used for outgoing IGMP packets.

parameter.name: VLANIDMark
parameter.description: VLAN ID (as defined in 802.1Q) to be used for outgoing IGMP packets. A value of -1 indicates the default value is to be used. If either the {{param}} or {{param|EthernetPriorityMark}} is greater than zero, then the outgoing frames MUST be tagged. Otherwise, the outgoing frames MAY be tagged or untagged.

parameter.name: EthernetPriorityMark
parameter.description: Ethernet priority code (as defined in 802.1D) to be used for outgoing IGMP packets. A value of -1 indicates the default value is to be used. If either the {{param|VLANIDMark}} or {{param}} are greater than zero, then the outgoing frames MUST be tagged. Otherwise, the outgoing frames MAY be tagged or untagged.

parameter.name: ClientVersion
parameter.description: The highest IGMP version supported by the IGMP Client.

parameter.name: ClientRobustness
parameter.description: Robustness is a way of indicating how vulnerable the network is to lost packets. IGMP can recover from robustness minus 1 lost IGMP packets. RFC 3376 specifies a default of 2.

parameter.name: ClientUnsolicitedReportInterval
parameter.description: The number of {{units}} between repetitions of a host's initial report of membership in a group. RFC 3376 specifies a default of 1s.

parameter.name: ClientGroupNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in the {{object|ClientGroup}} table.

parameter.name: ClientGroupStatsNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in the {{object|ClientGroupStats}} table.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.IGMP.ClientGroup.{i}.
object.description: IGMP Group table. This is the database that is maintained by the IGMP client to reflect the current group membership. The CPE MUST support at least ''MaximumNumberOfConcurrentGroups'' table entries.

parameter.name: GroupAddress
parameter.description: The IP multicast group address for which this entry contains information.

parameter.name: UpTime
parameter.description: Time elapsed in {{units}} since the multicast group has been a member on this interface.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.IGMP.ClientGroupStats.{i}.
object.description: IGMP Group statistics table. This stores per-group historical statistical data. The CPE MUST support at least ''MaximumNumberOfTrackedGroups'' table entries. The CPE MAY reclaim entries based on the oldest membership reports.

parameter.name: GroupAddress
parameter.description: The IP multicast group address for which this entry contains information.

parameter.name: TotalStart
parameter.description: Number of {{units}} since the beginning of the period used for collection of {{object|Total}} statistics. Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this may not always be possible.

parameter.name: CurrentDayStart
parameter.description: Number of {{units}} since the beginning of the period used for collection of {{object|CurrentDay}} statistics. The CPE MAY align the beginning of each {{object|CurrentDay}} interval with days in the UTC time zone, but is not required to do so. Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this may not always be possible.

parameter.name: QuarterHourStart
parameter.description: Number of {{units}} since the beginning of the period used for collection of {{object|QuarterHour}} statistics. The CPE MAY align the beginning of each {{object|QuarterHour}} interval with real-time quarter-hour intervals, but is not required to do so. Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this may not always be possible.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.IGMP.ClientGroupStats.{i}.Total.
object.description: Total statistics for this multicast group.

parameter.name: NumberOfJoins
parameter.description: Number of IGMP joins during this period.

parameter.name: NumberOfLeaves
parameter.description: Number of IGMP leaves during this period.

parameter.name: MaxJoinDelay
parameter.description: Maximum latency delay, in {{units}}, from the sending of a Join message for this group to the arrival of the first IP packet for this group during this period.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.IGMP.ClientGroupStats.{i}.CurrentDay.
object.description: Current day statistics for this multicast group.

parameter.name: NumberOfJoins
parameter.description: Number of IGMP joins during this period.

parameter.name: NumberOfLeaves
parameter.description: Number of IGMP leaves during this period.

parameter.name: MaxJoinDelay
parameter.description: Maximum latency delay, in {{units}}, from the sending of a Join message for this group to the arrival of the first IP packet for this group during this period.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.IGMP.ClientGroupStats.{i}.QuarterHour.
object.description: Current quarter hour statistics for this multicast group.

parameter.name: NumberOfJoins
parameter.description: Number of IGMP joins during this period.

parameter.name: NumberOfLeaves
parameter.description: Number of IGMP leaves during this period.

parameter.name: MaxJoinDelay
parameter.description: Maximum latency delay, in {{units}}, from the sending of a Join message for this group to the arrival of the first IP packet for this group during this period.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.Dejittering.
object.description: Parameters related to the de-jittering buffer configuration for all inbound IP streams.

parameter.name: BufferSize
parameter.description: De-jittering buffer size, measured in {{units}}, on the receiver side of the CPE. The STB is responsible for converting this into the actual buffer size in ''bytes''.

parameter.name: BufferInitialLevel
parameter.description: Describes the number of {{units}} worth of data that should be in the receiver side dejittering buffer before play-out can start. Typically this would be half of the buffer size.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.Inbound.{i}.
object.description: Inbound IP streams currently entering the STB via this front-end.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this Inbound stream. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: StreamingControlProtocol
parameter.description: Network protocol currently used for controlling streaming of the source content, or {{empty}} if the content is not being streamed or is being streamed but is not being controlled.

parameter.name: StreamingTransportProtocol
parameter.description: Network protocol currently used for streaming the source content, or an empty string if the content is not being streamed.

parameter.name: StreamingTransportControlProtocol
parameter.description: Transport control protocol currently used for streaming the source content, or an empty string if the content is not being streamed.

parameter.name: MultiplexType
parameter.description: AV multiplex type currently used for the source content, or an empty string if the content is not being demultiplexed.

parameter.name: DownloadTransportProtocol
parameter.description: Network protocol currently used for downloading the source content, or an empty string if the content is not being downloaded.

parameter.name: SourceAddress
parameter.description: IP address of the source of the current stream content.

parameter.name: SourcePort
parameter.description: TCP or UDP port number of the source of the current stream content, or 0 if the content is not being delivered via IP or if not applicable.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: IP address of the destination of the current stream content, or {{empty}} if the content is not being delivered via IP.

parameter.name: DestinationPort
parameter.description: TCP or UDP port number of the destination of the current stream content, or 0 if the content is not being delivered via IP or if not applicable.

parameter.name: URI
parameter.description: RFC 3986 URI that indicates the current source (possibly including Multicast group and port, if relevant) of the stream content, or {{empty}} if the source is not known or cannot be represented as a URI. For example, for a WAN-delivered stream this might be a content provider's URL, or for a LAN-delivered stream it might be an UPnP AV URN. If specified, the URI MUST be consistent with the other source-related parameters.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.Outbound.{i}.
object.description: Parameters related to an outbound IP stream.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this Outbound stream. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: MultiplexType
parameter.description: AV multiplex type currently used for the destination content, or an empty string if the content is not being demultiplexed.

parameter.name: URI
parameter.description: RFC 3986 URI that indicates the current destination (possibly including Multicast group and port, if relevant) of the stream content, or an empty string if the destination is not known or cannot be represented as a URI. For example, this might be an UPnP AV URN.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.ServiceConnect.
object.description: Parameters used to force connection to a dedicated IP stream for test purposes.

parameter.name: URI
parameter.description: RFC 3986 URI that describes the service to connect to in the form: * <trsp>://<addr>:<port>?StrCtrl=<strctrl>?StrTrspCtrl=<trspctrl>?MuxType=<muxtype> where: * '''<addr>''' is the IP address of the service source (for Unicast) or IGMP group (for Multicast). * '''<port>''' is the associated TCP/UDP port. If not specified, the STB is assumed to know and use an appropriate default port. * '''<trsp>''' is the streaming transport protocol and MUST be one of the values in {{param|.Capabilities.FrontEnd.IP.StreamingTransportProtocols}}, which SHOULD be converted to lower-case. * '''<strctrl>''' is the streaming control protocol and MUST be one of the values in {{param|.Capabilities.FrontEnd.IP.StreamingControlProtocols}}. If not specified, no streaming control protocol is to be used. * '''<trspctrl>''' is the streaming transport control protocol and MUST be one of the values in {{param|.Capabilities.FrontEnd.IP.StreamingTransportControlProtocols}}. If not specified, no streaming transport control protocol is to be used. * '''<muxtype>''' is the multiplex type and MUST be one of the values in {{param|.Capabilities.FrontEnd.IP.MultiplexTypes}}. This tells the STB which multiplex type to expect. If not specified, the STB is assumed to know, or to be able to determine, the multiplex type. Note that download protocols are not supported by the above syntax. However, the specified syntax is just a baseline, and STBs MAY support an extended syntax. Example of Multicast MPEG2-TS over RTP with no transport control: * rtp://224.112.15.18:3257?StrCtrl=IGMP?MuxType=MPEG2-TS Example of Multicast MPEG2-TS over RTP with AL-FEC transport control: * rtp://224.112.15.18:3257?StrCtrl=IGMP?StrTrspCtrl=AL-FEC?MuxType=MPEG2-TS Example of Unicast MPEG2-TS over UDP with RTSP transport control: * udp://174.146.35.12:3257?StrCtrl=RTSP?MuxType=MPEG2-TS Example of Unicast raw AV over RTP with RTCP control and RTSP transport control: * rtp://174.146.35.12:3257?StrCtrl=RTSP?StrTrspCtrl=RTCP?MuxType=None If a {{object|.ServiceMonitoring.MainStream}} instance with ''ServiceType'' = ''IP'' or ''IPTV'' (or ''VoD'' if the URI accesses a VoD service) is currently enabled, the STB MUST ensure that performance data for this service is collected in that instance. The value is not saved in device state. The value when read is not specified and need not be the value that was most recently written.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.PVR.
object.description: PVR details. This is a read-only object that exists only to reference PVR storage objects.

parameter.name: StorageNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|Storage}} instances.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.PVR.Storage.{i}.
object.description: PVR storage table. There MUST be an instance for each storage object that can be accessed by the PVR. Entries MAY be dynamically created and deleted as storage devices become available and unavailable.

parameter.name: Reference
parameter.description: References the corresponding ''StorageService'' {{bibref|TR-140}} instance, or an object contained within such an instance, e.g. a ''PhysicalMedium'', ''LogicalVolume'' or ''Folder'' instance. The value is the full hierarchical name of the corresponding object. Example: ''Device.Services.StorageService.1''

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.AudioDecoder.{i}.
object.description: Audio decoder instance table. It contains data representing the current status of the Audio decoder.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this audio decoder.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this audio decoder. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Human-readable name associated with this audio decoder.

parameter.name: AudioStandard
parameter.description: Audio standard currently being processed by this audio decoder, or an empty string if no audio standard is currently being processed.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.VideoDecoder.{i}.
object.description: Video decoder instance table. It contains data representing the current status of the video decoder.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this video decoder.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this video decoder. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Human-readable name associated with this video decoder.

parameter.name: MPEG2Part2
parameter.description: MPEG2 Part 2 profile and level object instance, or {{empty}} if MPEG2 Part 2 is not used. For example: ''.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.MPEG2Part2.ProfileLevel.2''

parameter.name: MPEG4Part2
parameter.description: MPEG4 Part 2 profile and level object instance, or {{empty}} if MPEG4 Part 2 is not used). For example: ''.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.MPEG4Part2.ProfileLevel.2''

parameter.name: MPEG4Part10
parameter.description: MPEG4 Part 10 profile and level object instance, or {{empty}} if MPEG4 Part 10 is not used. For example: ''.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.MPEG4Part10.ProfileLevel.2''

parameter.name: SMPTEVC1
parameter.description: SMPTE-VC-1 profile and level object instance, or {{empty}} if SMPTE-VC-1 is not used. For example: ''.Capabilities.VideoDecoder.SMPTEVC1.ProfileLevel.2''

parameter.name: ContentAspectRatio
parameter.description: Indicates the native aspect ratio of the content available at this decoder.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.AudioOutput.{i}.
object.description: Audio output instance table.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this audio output.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this audio output. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Human-readable name associated with this audio output.

parameter.name: AudioFormat
parameter.description: Currently active audio output format, or {{empty}} if no audio output format is currently active. Note that this parameter refers to output formats and not to physical connectors.

parameter.name: AudioLevel
parameter.description: The audio level on this audio output in {{units}} (0 is quietest and 100 is loudest). This setting is independent of the mute status. For some audio formats, the audio level is not meaningful, in which case this parameter SHOULD have a fixed value of 0.

parameter.name: CancelMute
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, cancels this audio output's mute status. Setting it to {{false}} has no effect. The value is not saved in device state and is always {{false}} when read.

parameter.name: SCARTs
parameter.description: SCART object instances associated with this audio output, or {{empty}} if not associated with any SCART object instances. For example: * ''.Components.SCART.2'' * ''.Components.SCART.2,.Components.SCART.3''

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.VideoOutput.{i}.
object.description: Video output instance table.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this video output.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this video output. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Human-readable name associated with this Video output.

parameter.name: CompositeVideoStandard
parameter.description: The type of analog video standard currently in use or {{empty}} if no analog video standard is currently in use. Note that this parameter applies only to the CVBS output format.

parameter.name: VideoFormat
parameter.description: Currently active video output format, or {{empty}} if no video output format is currently active. Note that this parameter refers to output formats and not to physical connectors.

parameter.name: AspectRatioBehaviour
parameter.description: Indicates the aspect ratio behaviour for display on monitors with an aspect ratio different from that of the content, which is specified in {{param|.Components.VideoDecoder.{i}.ContentAspectRatio}} (e.g. reproduction of HD content on SD monitors and vice versa).

parameter.name: Macrovision
parameter.description: Indicates whether Macrovision analog protection is being used on this video output. The Macrovision version supported is indicated in {{param|.Capabilities.VideoOutput.Macrovision}}.

parameter.name: HDCP
parameter.description: Indicates whether HDCP is being used on this video output. The HDCP version supported is indicated in {{param|.Capabilities.VideoOutput.HDCP}}.

parameter.name: SCARTs
parameter.description: SCART object instances associated with this video output, or {{empty}} if not associated with any SCART object instances. For example: * ''.Components.SCART.2'' * ''.Components.SCART.2,.Components.SCART.3''

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.SCART.{i}.
object.description: SCART configuration. This object allows configuration of the STB's AV switching.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this SCART connector.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this SCART connector. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Human-readable name associated with this connector.

parameter.name: Presence
parameter.description: Enables or disables the Presence control signal (pin 8 of the SCART connector), an output from the STB to control the display device connected to the SCART. When enabled (set to {{true}}) the STB MUST drive pin 8 to the appropriate level to indicate the output video format (SD or HD) to the connected device. When disabled (set to {{false}}) the STB MUST NOT drive pin 8.

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.CA.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the characteristics of the Conditional Access, if any.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this CA system.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this CA system. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Indicates a unique identifier (e.g. the commercial name: ''La 7 piu'', ''Mediaset Premium'') for this CA system.

parameter.name: SmartCardReader
parameter.description: Path name of the smart card reader object instance containing the smart card (if any) associated with this CA system. The value MUST be {{empty}} (if not associated with a smart card) or else be the full path name of the corresponding smart card reader object. For example: ''Device.SmartCardReader.1''

object.name: STBService.{i}.Components.DRM.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the characteristics of the Digital Rights Management, if any.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this DRM system.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this DRM system. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Indicates a unique identifier (e.g. the commercial name: ''La 7 piu'', ''Mediaset Premium'') for this DRM system.

parameter.name: SmartCardReader
parameter.description: Path name of the smart card reader object instance containing the smart card (if any) associated with this DRM system. The value MUST be {{empty}} (if not associated with a smart card) or else be the full path name of the corresponding smart card reader object. For example: ''Device.SmartCardReader.1''

object.name: STBService.{i}.AVStreams.
object.description: AV Streams object. If more than one AV stream can be active at a time, it may contain several {{object|AVStream}} instances.

parameter.name: ActiveAVStreams
parameter.description: Number of AV streams currently active (i.e. with ''Status'' != ''Disabled'', which means audio or AV data are being processed).

parameter.name: AVStreamNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|AVStream}} instances.

object.name: STBService.{i}.AVStreams.AVStream.{i}.
object.description: Details of each AVStream. AV streams are created statically. Each AV stream corresponds to a valid ''{FrontEnd, AudioDecoder, VideoDecoder}'' instance combination (although if the PVR is active for this stream, only ''{FrontEnd}'' or ''{AudioDecoder, VideoDecoder}'' will be in use).

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this AV stream. {{enum}} An AV stream is disabled if any of the referenced objects are disabled. If an AV stream is disabled then the values of other AV stream parameters are not significant. The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Human-readable name associated with this stream, e.g. read from the DVB service information metadata.

parameter.name: PVRState
parameter.description: Indicates whether this stream is using the PVR and, if so, the PVR state. {{enum}} PVR record state can be inferred from whether the stream has an input FrontEnd: if so and {{param}} is not {{enum|Disabled}}, the PVR is recording.

enumeration.description: PVR not used by this stream

parameter.name: FrontEnd
parameter.description: Input FrontEnd object instance associated with this AV stream, or {{empty}} if not associated with a FrontEnd object). For example: ''.Components.FrontEnd.2''

parameter.name: Inbound
parameter.description: Inbound IP stream object instance associated with the FrontEnd for this AV stream, or {{empty}} if the inbound stream is not delivered over IP. For example: ''.Components.FrontEnd.2.Inbound.3''

parameter.name: Outbound
parameter.description: Outbound IP stream object instance associated with the output FrontEnd for this AV stream (which is always the IP FrontEnd), or {{empty}} if the outbound stream is not delivered over IP. For example: ''.Components.FrontEnd.2.Outbound.3''

parameter.name: AudioDecoder
parameter.description: Audio Decoder object instance associated with this AV stream, or {{empty}} if not associated with an Audio Decoder object. For example: ''.Components.AudioDecoder.2''

parameter.name: VideoDecoder
parameter.description: Video Decoder object instance associated with this AV stream, or {{empty}} if not associated with a Video Decoder object. For example: ''.Components.VideoDecoder.2''

parameter.name: CA
parameter.description: CA system object instance associated with this AV stream, or {{empty}} if not associated with a CA object. For example: ''.Components.CA.2''

parameter.name: DRM
parameter.description: DRM system object instance associated with this AV stream, or {{empty}} if not associated with a DRM object. For example: ''.Components.DRM.2''

object.name: STBService.{i}.AVPlayers.
object.description: AV Players object. If more than one AV player can be active at a time, it may contain several {{object|AVPlayer}} instances. AV players are created statically. Each AV player corresponds to a combination of several AV streams (one main screen video, several PIP, one audio) being connected to an AV presentation device (such as a TV set). There is no guarantee that the STB has the resources to enable all of its AV players at the same time.

parameter.name: ActiveAVPlayers
parameter.description: Number of AV players currently active (i.e. with ''Status'' != ''Disabled'', which means the {{object|AVPlayer}} is processing an audio or AV stream).

parameter.name: AVPlayerNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|AVPlayer}} instances.

parameter.name: PreferredAudioLanguage
parameter.description: Human-readable string, as specified in {{bibref|RFC3066}}, describing the audio language that SHOULD be used by the STB when receiving a multi-language audio multiplex. {{empty}} indicates that there is no preferred audio language.

parameter.name: PreferredSubtitlingLanguage
parameter.description: Human-readable string, as specified in {{bibref|RFC3066}}, describing the subtitling language that SHOULD be used by the STB when receiving multi-language subtitling. A value of ''None'' indicates that no subtitling is required. {{empty}} indicates that there is no preferred subtitling language.

object.name: STBService.{i}.AVPlayers.AVPlayer.{i}.
object.description: List of AV Player objects. Each item is one particular AV player being processed by the STB.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this AV player.

parameter.name: Status
Name
parameter.description: Human-readable name associated with this AV player.

parameter.name: AudioLanguage
parameter.description: Human-readable string, as specified in {{bibref|RFC3066}}, describing the audio language being currently processed by the AV player.

parameter.name: SubtitlingStatus
SubtitlingLanguage
parameter.description: Human-readable string, as specified in {{bibref|RFC3066}}, describing the subtitling language being currently processed by the AV player. Subtitles are assumed to be shown only on the main screen.

parameter.name: AudioOutputs
parameter.description: Audio output object instances associated with this AV player, or {{empty}} if not associated with any audio output object instances. For example: ''.Components.AudioOutput.2''

parameter.name: VideoOutputs
parameter.description: Video output object instances associated with this AV player, or {{empty}} if not associated with any video output object instances. For example: ''.Components.VideoOutput.2''

parameter.name: MainStream
parameter.description: AV stream object instance associated with this AV player that is being sent to the main screen, or {{empty}} if not associated with an AV stream object. For example: ''.AVStreams.AVStream.2''

parameter.name: PIPStreams
parameter.description: AV stream object instances associated with this AV player that are being displayed as Picture In Picture (PIP), or {{empty}} if not associated with any PIP AV stream objects. For example: * ''.AVStreams.AVStream.2'' * ''.AVStreams.AVStream.2,.AVStreams.AVStream.3''

object.name: STBService.{i}.ServiceMonitoring.
object.description: Contains statistics relating to the QoS / QoE of Main AV streams. These statistics are broken down into categories, e.g. de-jittering and RTP, and for each category there are two types of statistics: * '''Total''' statistics, which count the number of occurrences of something. * '''Sample''' statistics, which are measured over a sample interval, and are made available to the ACS as a list of the most recent n samples. Total statistics are always collected (collection cannot be disabled, but the values can be reset). For Sample statistics, an STB uses a single sample interval and number of samples (n) for all {{object|MainStream}} instances. The sample interval can be aligned with absolute time. When Sample statistics collection is enabled, statistics collection MUST proceed regardless of whether there are any active Main AV streams. For example, when the STB is in Standby mode, there will be no active Main AV streams, but sample intervals will continue to be timed as normal. Refer to {{bibref|TR-135|I.3}} for non-normative explanation of the operation of the ''ServiceMonitoring'' object.

parameter.name: SampleEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables collection of Sample statistics. When collection of Sample statistics is enabled, any stored samples are discarded, and the first sample interval begins immediately.

parameter.name: SampleState

enumeration.description: Collection is enabled and the ACS should now fetch the collected data

parameter.name: SampleInterval
parameter.description: The sample interval in {{units}}. Each statistic is measured over this sample interval. The STB MAY reject a request to set {{param}} to less than {{param|.Capabilities.ServiceMonitoring.MinSampleInterval}}. Sample intervals MUST begin every {{param}} seconds, with no delay between samples. If {{param}} is changed while collection of Sample statistics is enabled, any stored samples are discarded, and the first sample interval begins immediately. For example, if {{param|ReportSamples}} is 24 and {{param}} is 3600 (an hour), the STB can store up to a day's worth of samples for each statistic.

parameter.name: ReportSamples
parameter.description: The number of samples that the STB can store and report for each statistic. The STB MUST permit {{param}} to be set to at least {{param|.Capabilities.ServiceMonitoring.MaxReportSamples}}. If {{param}} is changed while collection of Sample statistics is enabled, the STB will truncate or extend its statistics buffers as appropriate, but statistics collection MUST NOT otherwise be affected. For example, if {{param}} is 24 and {{param|SampleInterval}} is 3600 (an hour), the STB can store up to a day's worth of samples for each statistic.

parameter.name: FetchSamples
parameter.description: If collection of Sample statistics is enabled and {{param}} is in the range [1:{{param|ReportSamples}}] then {{param|SampleState}} MUST transition from {{enum|Enabled|SampleState}} -> {{enum|Trigger|SampleState}} -> {{enum|Enabled|SampleState}} on completion of every {{param}} sample intervals. Otherwise, this transition MUST NOT occur. For example, if {{param|ReportSamples}} is 25 and {{param}} is 24, then the STB will store 25 values for each statistic and the above {{param|SampleState}} transition will occur every 24 sample intervals, which means that the ACS could delay for up to two sample intervals before reading the stored values and would still not miss any samples (see also {{param|ForceSample}}).

parameter.name: TimeReference
parameter.description: An absolute time reference in UTC to determine when sample intervals will complete. Each sample interval MUST complete at this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of {{param|SampleInterval}}. This time reference also determines when the {{param|SampleState}} {{enum|Enabled|SampleState}} -> {{enum|Trigger|SampleState}} -> {{enum|Enabled|SampleState}} transitions that are controlled by {{param|FetchSamples}} will occur. If collection of Sample statistics is enabled and {{param|FetchSamples}} is in the range [1:{{param|ReportSamples}}] then each such {{param|SampleState}} transition MUST occur at this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of {{param|FetchSamples}} * {{param|SampleInterval}} (the fetch interval). {{param}} is used only to set the "phase" of the sample and fetch intervals. The actual value of {{param}} can be arbitrarily far into the past or future. If {{param}} is changed while collection of Sample statistics is enabled, any stored samples are discarded, and the first sample interval begins immediately. The Unknown Time value defined in {{bibref|TR-106a1}} indicates that no particular time reference is specified. That is, the STB MAY locally choose the time reference, and is required only to adhere to the specified sample and fetch intervals. If absolute time is not available to the STB, its sample and fetch interval behavior MUST be the same as if the {{param}} parameter was set to the Unknown Time value. For example, if {{param|SampleInterval}} is 3600 (an hour) and if {{param}} is set to UTC midnight on some day (in the past, present, or future) then sample intervals will complete on each UTC hour (00:00, 01:00, 02:00 etc). If, in addition, {{param|FetchSamples}} is 24, then the fetch interval is 86400 (a day) and {{param|SampleState}} {{enum|Enabled|SampleState}} -> {{enum|Trigger|SampleState}} -> {{enum|Enabled|SampleState}} transitions will occur every day at UTC midnight. Note that, if {{param}} is set to a time other than the Unknown Time, the first sample interval (which has to begin immediately) will almost certainly be shorter than {{param|SampleInterval}}). This is why {{param}} is defined in terms of when sample intervals complete rather than start.

parameter.name: ForceSample
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, forces statistics for the current sample to be calculated and updated in the data model. Setting it to {{false}} has no effect. The value is not saved in device state and is always {{false}} when read. If this is the first time that {{param}} has been set to true during the current sample interval, this MUST cause a new value to be added to each of the Sample statistics comma-separated list parameters, and the {{param|ReportEndTime}} and all ''SampleSeconds'' parameters MUST be updated accordingly. If this is not the first time that {{param}} has been set to {{true}} during the current sample interval, then the new values that were added as described in the previous paragraph, and the {{param|ReportEndTime}} and all ''SampleSeconds'' parameters, MUST be updated accordingly. Note that {{param}} just provides a ''sneak preview'' of the current sample. It does not create a new sample and it does not interfere with the sample interval schedule. At the end of each sample interval, if {{param}} was set to {{true}} during the sample interval then the new values that were added as described above, and the {{param|ReportEndTime}} and all ''SampleSeconds'' parameters, will be updated accordingly. In other words, the partial sample data that was created when {{param}} was set to {{true}} will be updated one last time at the end of the sample interval.

parameter.name: ReportStartTime
parameter.description: The absolute time at which the sample interval for the first stored sample (for each statistic) started.

parameter.name: ReportEndTime
parameter.description: The absolute time at which the sample interval for the last stored sample (for each statistic) ended. If {{param|ForceSample}} has been used to force statistics for the current sample to be calculated and updated in the data model, then {{param}} MUST be updated to reflect the actual time over which stored data was collected.

parameter.name: MainStreamNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of {{object|MainStream}} instances.

object.name: STBService.{i}.ServiceMonitoring.MainStream.{i}.
object.description: List of Main AV stream objects. Each instance is associated with a specified service type and will collect statistics only for the main stream that matches that service type. Note that this means that streams that do not match an instance's service type MUST NOT contribute to the instance's Total and Sample statistics. It is up to the STB to determine which AV stream should be regarded as the Main AV stream for a given service type at any given time. For example, if two active streams are associated with the same service type, the STB might prefer streams that are associated with an AV player, or if more than one stream is associated with an AV player, the STB might prefer a player that is outputting a DVI stream to a player that is outputting an RF stream. Note that some parameters, e.g. {{param|.Components.FrontEnd.{i}.IP.ServiceConnect.URI}}, include requirements that restrict the STB's freedom to determine which AV stream should be regarded as the Main AV stream for a given service.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables collection of Total and Sample statistics for this object instance.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Total and Sample statistics collection status for this object instance. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: ServiceType
parameter.description: Service type associated with this main stream instance, or {{empty}} if this instance is disabled. The STB MUST reject a request that would result in a given AV stream contributing to more than one {{object|.ServiceMonitoring.MainStream}} instance, e.g. it would reject a request to enable simultaneous collection of both IPTV and IP statistics, or to collect IPTV statistics on more than one instance.

parameter.name: AVStream
parameter.description: Main AV stream object instance currently associated with this ''ServiceMonitoring'' main stream instance. For example: ''.AVStreams.AVStream.2'' Note that, during the period of time over which Sample statistics are stored, this ''ServiceMonitoring'' main stream instance might be associated with many different ''AVStream'' instances. This parameter just provides information about which ''AVStream'' is currently being monitored.

parameter.name: Gmin
parameter.description: Minimum number of consecutive received packets after the end of an RTP Loss Event. A Loss Event is defined as as a sequence of lost packets, possibly including islands of received packets. Each island consists of up to ({{param}} - 1) received packets (a sequence of {{param}} received packets terminates the Loss Event, and so is not an island).

parameter.name: SevereLossMinDistance
parameter.description: The minimum distance required between error events before an RTP Loss Event is considered severe. Used in the calculation of ''SevereLossIndexCount'' and ''SevereLossIndexCountBeforeEC''.

parameter.name: SevereLossMinLength
parameter.description: The minimum value for the count of lost packets per RTP Loss Event before the count of lost packets is considered severe. Used in the calculation of ''SevereLossLengthCount'' and ''SevereLossLengthCountBeforeEC''.

object.name: STBService.{i}.ServiceMonitoring.MainStream.{i}.Total.
object.description: Total statistics since this ''ServiceMonitoring'' main stream instance was last enabled or Total statistics were last reset.

parameter.name: Reset
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, resets Total statistics for this ''ServiceMonitoring'' main stream instance. Setting it to {{false}} has no effect. The value is not saved in device state and is always {{false}} when read.

parameter.name: ResetTime
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the Total statistics were last enabled or reset for this ''ServiceMonitoring'' main stream instance.

object.name: STBService.{i}.ServiceMonitoring.MainStream.{i}.Total.DejitteringStats.
object.description: Total de-jittering statistics for this ''ServiceMonitoring'' main stream instance.

parameter.name: Overruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the receive jitter buffer has overrun for this AV stream.

parameter.name: Underruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the receive jitter buffer has underrun for this AV stream.

object.name: STBService.{i}.ServiceMonitoring.MainStream.{i}.Total.RTPStats.
object.description: Total RTP statistics for this ''ServiceMonitoring'' main stream instance. If no EC is applied the ''BeforeEC'' statistics provide the same values as the corresponding statistics, e.g. when there is no EC, {{param|PacketsReceivedBeforeEC}} = {{param|PacketsReceived}}.

parameter.name: PacketsExpected
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets expected for this AV stream as described in {{bibref|RFC3550|A.3}}.

parameter.name: PacketsDiscarded
parameter.description: Total number of packets discarded at the RTP layer for this AV stream because they were too late for playout, regardless of their being out of sequence or not. These statistics are collected when no EC is applied or after any EC if available.

parameter.name: PacketsOutOfSequence
parameter.description: Total number of packets out of sequence at the RTP level for this AV stream, regardless of their being too late for playout or not. These statistics are collected when no EC is applied or after any EC if available.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets received for this AV stream. These statistics are collected when no EC is applied or after any EC if available.

parameter.name: PacketsReceivedBeforeEC
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets received for this AV stream. These statistics are collected before any EC, if available, is applied.

parameter.name: PacketsLost
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets lost for this stream. These statistics are collected when no EC is applied or after any EC if available.

parameter.name: PacketsLostBeforeEC
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets lost for this stream. These statistics are collected before any EC, if available, is applied.

parameter.name: LossEvents
parameter.description: Total number of Loss Events for this stream. These statistics are collected when no EC is applied or after any EC if available.

parameter.name: LossEventsBeforeEC
parameter.description: Total number of Loss Events for this stream. These statistics are collected before any EC, if available, is applied.

parameter.name: SevereLossIndexCount
parameter.description: Total number of Loss Events closer than ''SevereLossMinDistance''. These statistics are collected when no EC is applied or after any EC if available.

parameter.name: SevereLossIndexCountBeforeEC
parameter.description: Total number of Loss Events closer than ''SevereLossMinDistance''. These statistics are collected before any EC, if available, is applied.

parameter.name: SevereLossLengthCount
parameter.description: Total number of Loss Events longer than ''SevereLossMinLength''. These statistics are collected when no EC is applied or after any EC if available.

parameter.name: SevereLossLengthCountBeforeEC
parameter.description: Total number of Loss Events longer than ''SevereLossMinLength''. These statistics are collected before any EC, if available, is applied.

parameter.name: RetransmitTimeouts
parameter.description: Total number of RTP/AVPF retransmission timeouts ({{bibref|RFC4585}}, {{bibref|RFC4588}}) If RTP/AVPF is not used this parameter does not increment

object.name: STBService.{i}.ServiceMonitoring.MainStream.{i}.Total.MPEG2TSStats.
object.description: Total MPEG2-TS statistics for this ''ServiceMonitoring'' main stream instance.

parameter.name: TSPacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of MPEG2-TS packets received for this AV stream.

parameter.name: TSSyncByteErrorCount
